00034 /**
00035  * \file
00036  *         Interface to the CC2420 AES encryption/decryption functions
00037  * \author
00038  *         Adam Dunkels <adam@sics.se>
00039  */
00040 
00041 #ifndef __CC2420_AES_H__
00042 #define __CC2420_AES_H__
00043 
00044 /**
00045  * \brief      Setup an AES key
00046  * \param key  A pointer to a 16-byte AES key
00047  * \param index The key index: either 0 or 1.
00048  *
00049  *             This function sets up an AES key with the CC2420
00050  *             chip. The AES key can later be used with the
00051  *             cc2420_aes_cipher() function to encrypt or decrypt
00052  *             data.
00053  *
00054  *             The CC2420 can store two separate keys in its
00055  *             memory. The keys are indexed as 0 or 1 and the key
00056  *             index is given by the 'index' parameter.
00057  *
00058  */
00059 void cc2420_aes_set_key(const uint8_t *key, int index);
00060 
00061 
00062 /**
00063  * \brief      Encrypt/decrypt data with AES
00064  * \param data A pointer to the data to be encrypted/decrypted
00065  * \param len  The length of the data to be encrypted/decrypted
00066  * \param key_index The key to use. The key must have previously been set up with cc2420_aes_set_key().
00067  *
00068  *             This function encrypts/decrypts data with AES. A
00069  *             pointer to the data is passed as a parameter, and the
00070  *             function overwrites the data with the encrypted data.
00071  *
00072  */
00073 void cc2420_aes_cipher(uint8_t *data, int len, int key_index);
00074 
00075 
00076 #endif /* __CC2420_AES_H__ */
Generated on Tue May 8 2012 20:12:58 for Contiki 2.5 by  1.7.4
